issues.description: The problem statement and template instruct using HTTP POST to create persons (POST /persons and webClient.post()), but the solution uses HTTP PUT for creation (@PutMapping("persons") in PersonResource and webClient.put() in PersonController). This mismatch in HTTP methods will confuse students about which verb to implement and conflicts with the specified API design.
issues.suggested_fix: Use HTTP POST for the createPerson endpoint and client request: change @PutMapping("persons") to @PostMapping("persons") in PersonResource, and use webClient.post() instead of webClient.put() in PersonController.addPerson.

issues.description: The problem specification requires creating a new person via a POST request to /persons, but the solution implementation uses PUT for both the server endpoint (@PutMapping("persons")) and the client-side addPerson (webClient.put()). This mismatch breaks the conceptual mapping from the problem (POST) to the code, leading students to implement the wrong HTTP verb.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the createPerson implementation with the problem statement by using @PostMapping("persons") on the server and webClient.post() in PersonController.addPerson instead of PUT.
